title: Jealousy & Trust
subtitle: From insecurity to secure relating
description: Jealousy isn't just about your partner—it's about your wounds, your attachment style, and your relationship with yourself. This course helps you understand jealousy, work with the insecurity beneath it, rebuild trust (in yourself and others), and relate from security rather than fear.

modules.title: Jealousy in the Moment
modules.description: What to do when jealousy hits

modules.title: Trust in Yourself
modules.description: Knowing you'll be okay no matter what

whatYouLearn: Understand what jealousy is really pointing to
Work with the attachment wounds beneath jealousy
Handle jealousy in real-time without acting out
Build trust in yourself and your ability to handle anything
Relate from security instead of fear
requirements: Willingness to look at your own patterns

questions.question: What is jealousy usually really about?
options: Your own wounds, attachment style, and fears of not being enough

questions.question: What wound often underlies jealousy?
options: Fear of abandonment, not-enoughness, or attachment insecurity

questions.question: When jealousy hits in the moment, what should you do?
options: Pause, feel it in your body, and respond rather than react

questions.question: What does 'trust in yourself' mean in this context?
options: Knowing you'll be okay no matter what happens—even worst-case scenarios
Trusting your jealousy is always right

questions.question: What is 'earned trust'?
options: Trust that's built over time through consistent actions and demonstrated reliability
